topics.title: Introduction to Lists
topics.theory: A list in Python is a collection of items. Lists can contain numbers, strings, or other lists. You define a list using square brackets [].
topics.exercise: 1. Create a list of three fruits and print it.

topics.title: Accessing List Elements
topics.theory: You can access list elements by their index, starting from 0. Use list_name[index].
topics.exercise: 2. Print the first and last item of a list called numbers.

topics.title: Modifying List Elements
topics.theory: You can change items in a list by assigning a new value to a specific index.
topics.exercise: 3. Replace the second fruit in a list with 'orange' and print the list.

topics.title: Adding Items to a List
topics.theory: Use the append() method to add items to the end of a list.
topics.exercise: 4. Add 'grape' to the list of fruits and print it.

topics.title: Loops and Lists
topics.theory: You can use a for loop to go through all the items in a list.
topics.exercise: 5. Print each fruit in a list using a for loop.

topics.title: Defining Functions
topics.theory: Functions help organize your code. Use 'def' to define a function. Functions can receive parameters and return values.
topics.exercise: 6. Write a function that adds two numbers and returns the result. Call the function and print the result.
topics.starter_code:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

result = add(3, 5)
print(result)
topics.solution:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

result = add(3, 5)
print(result)
